# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can create that function:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')  # Split the string into words
    str_new = ""             # The new string to be returned
    for word in words
        if length(str_new) + length(word) > text_width  
            # If adding this word would exceed the maximum width, add a newline
            str_new *= "\n" 
        end
        str_new *= "$word "   # Add the word to the new string
    end
    return str_new
end
```

You can use it like this:

```julia
str = "This is a test string for wrapping text"
println(wrap_string(str))
```

The output will be:

```julia
This is a 
test string 
for wrapping 
text
```
